channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: How to watch the Olympic opening ceremony. And, the Obamas endorse Harris
item.description: Barack and Michelle Obama endorsed Vice President Kamala Harris for president Friday. This comes a day after she reiterated her support for Israel. And, how to watch the Olympic opening ceremony.
item.content:encoded:
Barack and Michelle Obama endorsed Vice President Kamala Harris for president Friday. This comes a day after she reiterated her support for Israel. And, how to watch the Olympic opening ceremony.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Harris asks Americans not to see the war in Gaza through a 'binary lens'
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris met with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Thursday. After the meeting what did she say about the humanitarian crisis and negotiations toward a cease-fire deal?
item.content:encoded: Vice President Kamala Harris met with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Thursday. After the meeting what did she say about the humanitarian crisis and negotiations toward a cease-fire deal?
item.dc:creator: Asma Khalid

item.title: The Obamas have endorsed Harris, capping a week where Democrats embraced her
item.description: The endorsements of former President Barack Obama and Michelle Obama cap a week where the Democratic party, for the most part, lined up behind Vice President Harris to become their nominee.
item.content:encoded:
The endorsements of former President Barack Obama and Michelle Obama cap a week where the Democratic party, for the most part, lined up behind Vice President Harris to become their nominee.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: Martin Indyk, former U.S. diplomat and author, dies at 73
item.description: Veteran diplomat Martin S. Indyk, an author and leader at prominent U.S. think tanks who devoted years to finding a path toward peace in the Middle East, died Thursday. He was 73.
item.content:encoded:
Veteran diplomat Martin S. Indyk, an author and leader at prominent U.S. think tanks who devoted years to finding a path toward peace in the Middle East, died Thursday. He was 73.

(Image credit: Charles Dharapak)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: From Obama to Harris - A look at what's changed
item.description: Code Switch digs into what a Black president would mean this time
item.content:encoded: Code Switch digs into what a Black president would mean this time
item.dc:creator: Leah Donnella

item.title: What do voters in suburban Pittsburgh make of the new presidential campaign?
item.description: We'll hear from some voters: the partisans still dug in through all the changes, and one undecided voter who will make you scratch your head.
item.content:encoded: We'll hear from some voters: the partisans still dug in through all the changes, and one undecided voter who will make you scratch your head.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Could you go a whole week without buying new plastic?
item.description: The amount of plastic that we throw out really piles up. A "Morning Edition" staffer decided to find out how hard it would be to not buy any new plastic for a week. How did she do?
item.content:encoded: The amount of plastic that we throw out really piles up. A "Morning Edition" staffer decided to find out how hard it would be to not buy any new plastic for a week. How did she do?
item.dc:creator: Claire Murashima

item.title: When will Kamala Harris be the official Democratic presidential nominee?
item.description: The Democratic National Committee will hold a virtual roll call in early August to select a new presidential nominee, likely Vice President Harris, before its convention kicks off in Chicago.
item.content:encoded:
The Democratic National Committee will hold a virtual roll call in early August to select a new presidential nominee, likely Vice President Harris, before its convention kicks off in Chicago.

(Image credit: Julia Nikhinson)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: Maternity care in rural areas is in crisis. Can more doulas help?
item.description: A Georgia medical school has begun training and deploying doulas in rural areas of the state, with the goal of decreasing the risk of childbirth complications, especially for Black women.
item.content:encoded:
A Georgia medical school has begun training and deploying doulas in rural areas of the state, with the goal of decreasing the risk of childbirth complications, especially for Black women.

(Image credit: Matthew Pearson)
item.dc:creator: Jess Mador

item.title: U.S. automakers had a punishing week — with a silver lining for shoppers
item.description: The four major U.S. automakers — GM, Ford, Stellantis and Tesla — all reported earnings this week and saw their stocks decline. The auto industry is at a "Darwinian" inflection point, says one CEO.
item.content:encoded:
The four major U.S. automakers — GM, Ford, Stellantis and Tesla — all reported earnings this week and saw their stocks decline. The auto industry is at a "Darwinian" inflection point, says one CEO.

(Image credit: Scott Olson)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske
